---
title: "package.json"

## High-level description
This `package.json` file defines the configuration and metadata for the "buffer" npm package. It provides a Node.js Buffer API implementation for browser environments, allowing developers to use Buffer-like functionality in client-side JavaScript.

## Dependencies
The package has two runtime dependencies:
| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| base64-js | Likely used for base64 encoding/decoding operations |
| ieee754 | Probably used for IEEE 754 floating-point arithmetic operations |

## Configuration
The package.json file defines various configuration options:

| Option | Type | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:------------|
| name | string | The name of the package: "buffer" |
| version | string | The current version: "5.7.1" |
| main | string | The main entry point of the package: "index.js" |
| types | string | The TypeScript type definitions file: "index.d.ts" |
| license | string | The license type: "MIT" |

## Scripts
The package defines several npm scripts for various tasks:

| Script | Purpose |
|:-------|:--------|
| test | Runs the standard linter and executes tests |
| perf | Runs performance tests in the browser |
| perf-node | Runs various performance tests in Node.js |
| size | Calculates the minified and gzipped size of the package |
| test-browser-es5 | Runs ES5 tests in the browser |
| test-browser-es6 | Runs ES6 tests in the browser |
| test-node | Runs tests in Node.js |
| update-authors | Updates the list of contributors |

## Additional Information
1. The package is authored by Feross Aboukhadijeh and has additional contributors.
2. It includes a list of keywords related to its functionality, such as "buffer", "browser", and "uint8array".
3. The repository is hosted on GitHub at https://github.com/feross/buffer.
4. The package includes configuration for JSPM, mapping the index.js file to the Node.js buffer module when used in a Node.js environment.
5. It specifies funding options for supporting the project through GitHub Sponsors, Patreon, and consulting services.
6. The package uses the "standard" JavaScript style guide and specifies some exceptions in the "standard" configuration section.

This package.json file provides a comprehensive overview of the "buffer" package, including its purpose, dependencies, development tools, and various scripts for testing and performance analysis.
